200001.name: Aabbt Kindred
200001.text: Independent: Aabbt Kindred cannot perform directed actions unless /Nefertiti/ is ready. Aabbt Kindred can prevent 1 damage each combat. Non-unique.

201663.name: Abaddon
201663.text: Independent: Abaddon gets 1 optional maneuver and 1 optional press each combat.

200005.name: Abdelsobek
200005.text: Independent: Abdelsobek can unlock a vampire or mummy you control as a +1 stealth action.

200007.ascii: Abid bin Haji, Scholar of Mirrors
200007.name: Abid bin Haji, Scholar of Mirrors

200008.name: Abiku
200008.text: Laibon: Abiku gets +1 stealth when hunting.

201623.name: Abraham DuSable
201623.text: Camarilla: During an action, Abraham can discard a card requiring Blood Sorcery [tha] to get +1 intercept or +1 stealth.

201634.name: Abraham Mellon

rulings.text: The ability ability cannot be used to fulfill card requirements if they are not played normally, like when using {Concealed Weapon} for an equipment or {Piper} or {The Summoning} for an ally.

When meeting a requirement to play a card, the vampire is treated as such for all the effects of the card, and only them, including duration effects. The vampire is not treated as meeting the requirements for effects the card has from being in play.

201634.text: Camarilla: Abraham can play cards requiring a Tremere as if he were a Tremere. While he is ready, you get +1 hand size.

200011.name: Adana de Sforza

rulings.text: Card with multiple types (eg. Combat/Action Modifier) are considered of the type they are played as, not both.

200011.text: Camarilla Brujah Inner Circle: Combat cards cost Adana 1 fewer blood. +2 bleed.
200011.title: inner circle

201635.name: Adelino Da Silva

rulings.text: The discount applies to the action, regardless of who pays.

201635.text: Camarilla: Rescuing an older vampire from torpor costs Adelino -2 blood.

200013.name: Adhiambo
200013.text: Laibon: Adhiambo gets +1 stealth during actions to equip with a weapon card from your hand and actions to enter combat with a minion.

201636.name: Adisa
201636.text: Camarilla: Adisa can enter combat with an ally or younger vampire as a (D) action. If she successfully hunts, she does not unlock as normal during her next unlock phase.

200014.name: Adonai
200014.text: Sabbat: Adonai can enter combat with any ready Camarilla vampire controlled by another Methuselah as a (D) action. He gets +1 strength when in combat with a Tremere. +1 bleed.

200015.name: Adri, The Seeker
200015.text: Independent: Adri gets +1 intercept against Ministers.

201664.name: Adrino Manauara
201664.text: Anarch Baron of Manaus: Adrino gets 1 press (mandatory) each combat, only usable to continue combat.
201664.title: baron

200017.name: Aeron

rulings.text: The damage inflicted by his ability is environmental.
His ability to get a press can only be used during the press step.
Damage is inflicted even against a dodge. A "strike: combat ends" ends combat before damage is applied, as will a combattant going to torpor during first strike.

200017.text: Sabbat Archbishop of London: Minions opposing Aeron in combat take an additional point of damage during strike resolution if the range is close. Once each combat, Aeron may burn a blood for a press.
200017.title: archbishop

200018.name: Afifa, The Herald
200018.text: Camarilla: When you put a Gehenna card in play, your prey burns 1 pool. If you do not put a Gehenna card in play during your discard phase, a ready vampire you control other than Afifa burns 1 blood, or you burn 1 pool.

200019.name: Agaitas, The Scholar of Antiquities

rulings.text: Additional draws are not subject to his ability (eg. {Infernal Pursuit}, {Aura Reading}, {Learjet}).

If Agaitas is burned while cards owned by your prey are still face-up in front of you, you can still play and discard them as normal, but you cannot draw in your prey's library until you control Agaitas anew.
Cards from his ability that go into an ash heap, hand, or library always go into their owner's ash heap, hand, or library (eg. using {Heart of Nizchetus}).
A weapon available from his ability can be chosen for a {Concealed Weapon}.
His ability only applies when the card is played. Any delay in the replacement prevents it (eg. {The Meddling of Semsith}, {Bum's Rush}).

200019.text: Sabbat: When you play a card, you may draw its replacement from your prey's library instead of your own. Put the card drawn face-up in front of you. It is still considered to be in your hand, to be played or discarded as normal.

200021.name: Ági
200021.text: Sabbat: Cards requiring Sanguinus [san] cost Ági 1 fewer blood. Budapest circle. Sterile.

200025.name: Aidan Lyle
200025.text: Camarilla: Aidan gets 1 optional press each combat.

200026.name: Aimee Laroux
200026.text: Independent: You can burn 1 pool and use 4 transfers to give Aimee +1 level of Melpominee [mel]. She cannot play reaction cards.

200027.name: Aimery Methuin
200027.text: Sabbat: Younger Camarilla vampires get -1 intercept against Aimery.

200028.name: Aisata Swanou
200028.text: Laibon: During your master phase, you may draw a card and move a card from your hand to either your ash heap or the top of your library.

200029.name: Aisha

rulings.text: "Once each turn" means once during each player's turn.

200029.text: Independent: Once each turn, Aisha can burn 1 blood to get +1 intercept for the current action.

200030.name: Aisha az-Zahra

rulings.text: The ability can be used while locked, only once per referendum.

200030.text: Anarch: During the polling step of any referendum, Aisha can burn 1 blood to get +1 vote for each ready Anarch you control. +1 bleed.

200031.name: Aisling Sturbridge
200031.text: Camarilla: Younger Tremere cannot block Aisling.

200032.name: Aiyana, The Wolfcatcher
200032.text: Sabbat: Aiyana gets an optional press each combat when opposing a werewolf, and she can burn a blood each round to prevent all damage a werewolf inflicts on her that round. Sterile.

200033.name: Akram

rulings.text: If his ability is used to start a new combat, effects that end combat and then do something else after combat (include continuing the action as if unblocked) will be lost, except for unlock effects.
His ability cannot be used to start a new combat if there is already a pending combat queued.
"Once each turn" means once during each player's turn.

200033.text: Camarilla primogen: Once each turn after completing combat, if Akram and the opposing minion are still ready, Akram may burn 1 blood to begin another combat with the opposing minion.
200033.title: primogen

200034.name: Aksinya Daclau

rulings.text: Her ability can only be used after blocks are declined.
"Once each turn" means once during each player's turn.
Can be used when failing to block because of stealth: it is still declining to block.

Must be used before action resolution, ie. before any modifier or reaction played "as the action/bleed would be successful" are played. It cannot be played after a {Spying Mission} on the vampire triggers.
Cannot be used to direct a bleed to a Methuselah who would be an invalid target for a bleed.

200034.text: Sabbat: Once each turn during a bleed against you, if Aksinya is ready and unlocked, you may discard a master card from your hand to redirect the bleed to any other Methuselah.

200035.name: Al-Ashrad, Amr of Alamut
200035.text: Independent: Al-Ashrad can burn a location requiring a clan as a (D) action that costs 2 blood. Blood cursed. +1 bleed.

200036.name: Al-Ashrad, Amr of Alamut
200036.text:
Camarilla: During the first round of combat, Al-Ashrad can use strikes requiring Blood Sorcery [tha] that are not usable during the first round. Blood cursed.
[MERGED] Banu Haqim Inner Circle: +1 bleed.

200037.name: Al-Muntaquim, The Avenger

rulings.text: Can use a multi-discipline card with a potential (unused) Celerity [cel] effect.
The scarce penalty considers the apparent clan while controlled (in case of {Clan Impersonation} and {Banishment}).

200037.text: Independent: During your unlock phase, you may burn a Caitiff you control to give Al-Muntaquim +1 bleed for the remainder of the game. Al-Muntaquim unlocks whenever a Gehenna card is played. He cannot use cards that require Celerity [cel]. Scarce.

200038.name: Al-Muntathir, God's Witness

rulings.text: Black Hand is not a title, it is a trait unrelated to any sect. The trait is not lost if the vampire changes sect.
Can use a multi-discipline card with a potential (unused) Celerity [cel] effect.
The scarce penalty considers the apparent clan while controlled (in case of {Clan Impersonation} and {Banishment}).

200038.text: Sabbat: If you control four or more True Brujah, burn Al-Muntathir. He cannot use cards requiring Celerity [cel]. Black Hand. Scarce.

200039.name: Alabástrom
200039.text: Anarch: If Alabástrom is ready during your turn, you can unlock another ready Gargoyle you control. Flight [FLIGHT].

200040.name: Alan Sovereign
200040.text: Camarilla: When you play an investment card, add an additional counter to it from the blood bank.

200041.name: Alan Sovereign
200041.text:
Advanced, Camarilla: While Alan is ready, you may pay some or all of the pool cost of equipping from any investment cards you control.
[MERGED] During your master phase, if Alan is ready, you may move a counter from any investment card to your pool.

200042.name: Alcoan
200042.text: Sabbat: If Alcoan is in combat with an ally or younger vampire, you can look at the opposing minion's controller's hand before range is determined during the first round.

200043.name: Aleister Crowley
200043.text: Camarilla: Frenzy cards cannot be played on Aleister.

200044.name: Alejandro Aguirre

rulings.text: If a card transforms the damage he inflicts to aggravated (eg. {True Faith}), this includes the damage from his ability.

200044.text: Sabbat: If Alejandro is ready, he may lock before range is determined in any combat that does not involve him to inflict 1 unpreventable damage on each combatant.

200046.name: Alessandro Garcia
200046.text: Sabbat: Alessandro gets +1 strength in combat with a Lasombra.

200047.name: Alex Camille
200047.text: Sabbat: During an action, Alex can burn 1 blood to get +1 intercept.

200048.name: Alex Wilkins
200048.text: Camarilla: If Alex successfully bleeds, the target Methuselah can burn 1 additional pool to steal him after resolution.

201529.name: Alexa Draper

rulings.text: The ability can be used while locked, only once per referendum.

201529.text: Camarilla Prince of Melbourne: During the polling step of any referendum, Alexa can discard a card requiring Dominate [dom] to get +1 vote.

201530.text: Camarilla Prince of Birmingham: Vampires must burn 1 blood to cast votes and ballots against referendums called by Alexander.
201530.title: prince

200049.name: Alexandra

rulings.text: Can use her unlock ability at any point during the turn, including during a political action.
If she locks a Toreador who was attempting to block, then that block will fail.
The ability can be used when in torpor.

200049.text: Camarilla Toreador Inner Circle: Once during your turn, you may lock or unlock another ready Toreador. +2 bleed.
200049.title: inner circle

200050.name: Alexis Sorokin
200050.text: Independent: Once each combat, Alexis can strike: dodge. She can steal an equipment as a (D) action. She gets +1 bleed against a Methuselah who controls a ready Toreador. Red List.

200051.text: Sabbat bishop: Alfred gets -1 strength in combat with an ally.

200052.text:

[MERGED] Archbishop of Montreal: During the polling step of any referendum, he can burn 1 blood to get +1 vote.

200054.title: archbishop

201575.name: Alicia Cortez
201575.text: Camarilla Prince of Tampa: After Alicia performs a successful directed action, you can discard a political action card [POLITICAL ACTION] to lock a younger vampire controlled by (one of) the target Methuselah(s).
201575.title: prince

201576.name: Aline Gädeke

rulings.text: Can unlock after a vampire performs an action to become Anarch.
The ability can be used when in torpor.
The after action resolution effect can be used if the action "fizzles" (is unblocked at resolution, but has no effect because some requirement cannot be met or cost can't be paid in full).

201576.text: Anarch Baron of Mannheim: Once each turn, Aline can burn 1 blood to unlock after another Anarch you control performs a successful action.
201576.title: baron

200057.name: Allonzo Montoya

rulings.text: The scarce penalty considers the apparent clan while controlled (in case of {Clan Impersonation} and {Banishment}).

200057.text: Independent: Allonzo gets +1 stealth on actions that require Serpentis [ser]. Allonzo cannot block undirected actions. Scarce. Sterile.

200060.name: Alonso Petrodon
200060.text: Camarilla Nosferatu Justicar: Alonso inflicts 1 unpreventable damage on each anarch controlled by the target of the bleed after bleeding successfully. +1 bleed.
200060.title: justicar

200061.name: Alonzo Guillen
200061.text: Camarilla: During your unlock phase and your discard phase, if Alonzo is ready, you may burn the Edge to look at another Methuselah's hand.

200063.name: Alvaro, The Scion of Angelica

rulings.text: He gains blood if he casts no vote, even if he has lost his title or is in torpor.

200063.text: Sabbat Archbishop of Pittsburgh: After resolution of any political action, if Alvaro abstained (even in torpor), he can gain 2 blood. +1 bleed.
200063.title: archbishop

rulings.text: The hunt bonus applies to non-standard hunt actions, blood comes from the target of the hunt.

200065.name: Amaravati

rulings.text: The ability can be used while locked or in torpor, only once per referendum.

200065.text: Independent: During the polling step of a political action, Amaravati can burn 2 blood to give each ready Banu Haqim you control +1 vote. Blood cursed.

rulings.text: Keeps their title and votes if they changes sects.

200069.name: Ambrogino Giovanni
200069.text:
Independent: During your unlock phase, Ambrogino can remove seven cards in your ash heap from the game to gain 2 blood. Red List. +1 bleed.
[MERGED] +1 stealth.

200070.name: Ambrosio Luis Monçada, Plenipotentiary

rulings.text: Actions from minions of the same controller targeting him are undirected, so they are not affected by his ability.

200070.text: Sabbat cardinal: Monçada cannot block. Actions directed at him cost 1 additional pool. If he is ready during your discard phase, you can unlock another ready Lasombra.
200070.title: cardinal

200071.name: Amelia
200071.text: Sabbat bishop: Amelia can enter combat with any vampire of capacity below 4 controlled by another Methuselah as a +1 stealth (D) action.
200071.title: bishop

200072.name: Amelia, The Blood Red Tears

rulings.text: Her ability triggers after combat if she's still in play, even in torpor. If she is burned during combat, it does not trigger.
If multiple combats occur in the same action, the opposing minion burns 1 blood or life each time the combat ends.
In the case of {Free Fight}, the last opposing minion burns the blood.
Any blood loss occurs after combat (and will not trigger {Anathema} or be available for {Taste of Vitae}, etc).

200072.text: Camarilla: After combat with Amelia, the opposing minion burns 1 blood or life.

200073.name: Amenophobis

rulings.text: The after action resolution effect can be used if the action "fizzles" (is unblocked at resolution, but has no effect because some requirement cannot be met or cost can't be paid in full).

200073.text: Camarilla primogen: You can draw 1 card (discard down afterward) after resolution of any successful action requiring Serpentis [ser]. Amenophobis gets +1 bleed against the Methuselah who has the Edge.
200073.title: primogen

200074.name: Amisa

rulings.text: Keeps their title and votes if they changes sects.

200074.text: Independent. 2 votes (titled): Amisa can lock a vampire with capacity 8 or more as a (D) action.
200074.title: 2 votes

200076.name: Anarch Convert

rulings.text: His "as he enters play" ability can be used before he enters contest if there is another one in play. This is not self-contesting.
Can "convert" an already anarch vampire if he is not titled.

200076.text: Anarch: As the convert enters play, you can remove him from the game to make a non-titled vampire you control Anarch and either gain 1 pool or draw 1 card from your crypt.

200078.name: Anastasz di Zagreb
200078.text: Camarilla Tremere Justicar: If there are any other justicars ready, Anastasz gets 1 fewer vote from his justicar title. Anastasz may steal 1 blood as a ranged strike.
200078.title: justicar

200079.name: Anatole, Prophet of Gehenna
200079.text: Camarilla: If Anatole is ready during your master phase, you may look at the top 5 cards of your library and then shuffle the top 5 cards of your library. +1 intercept.

200080.name: Andre LeRoux

rulings.text: His ability can be used only once per successful bleed, but can be used multiple times on different bleeds during the same turn.
It is used in the "would/about to be successful" window like {Spying Mission}.
Only modifiers and reactions that can be played "when the action/bleed would be successful" can be played after it.
He can use his ability on his own bleed to get (-1 +2) = +1 bleed.
His ability cannot be used after {Spying Mission}. If his ability reduces a bleed to zero, it is no longer successful and {Spying Mission} cannot be used afterwards.

200080.text: Camarilla: If a vampire you control would successfully bleed, you can reduce the bleed amount by 1 to give Andre +2 bleed this turn.

200081.name: André the Manipulator
200081.text: Camarilla: While André is ready, you get +2 hand size.

200082.name: Andrea Giovanni
200082.text: Independent: Andrea gets +1 stealth during actions requiring Necromancy [nec].

200083.name: Andreas, The Bard of Crete

rulings.text: "Once each turn" means once during each player's turn.

200083.text: Camarilla primogen: Once each turn, Andreas may burn 1 blood to get +1 intercept for the current action.
200083.title: primogen

200086.name: Andrew Stuart

rulings.text: His ability needs to be applied before anyone has an opportunity to play another cancellation effect (eg. {Direct Intervention}).

Cards are not replaced during the "as played" window. The cancelation must be played immediately: no other effects can be used, except for wakes (eg. neither {The Barrens} nor {Dreams of the Sphinx} can be used).
If the canceled card had a "do not replace until" clause (or alternate replacement like {Steely Tenacity}), that clause is canceled as well and the card is replaced normally.
The canceled card has still been played. The same reaction or modifier cannot be played again by the same minion. Any card which text prohibits to play more than once cannot be played again.
If a limited effect is canceled (bleed, additional strike), then the limit is not triggered and another limited effect can be used.
If an action is canceled, it is not performed and the minion is free to attempt the same action again.
Can only cancel minion cards played from the hand in the normal fashion (eg. can't cancel allies played via {Piper}).
Can be used to cancel all action cards, including employ retainer, recruit ally and political action.

200086.text: Camarilla: As Andrew plays a card requiring Blood Sorcery [tha] (before replacing the card), reveal the top card of your library. If it also requires Blood Sorcery, the card played is canceled and Andrew burns 1 blood.

200087.name: Andy
200087.text: Camarilla: An older vampire opposing Andy gets one optional press each combat.

200090.name: Angela Decker
200090.text: Sabbat: After Angela is burned in combat, burn 2 pool.

200091.name: Angela Preston

rulings.text: When she is influenced out, her ability to unlock a vampire can be used during the ongoing influence phase.
The ability can be used when in torpor.

200091.text: Camarilla: During your influence phase, Angela can lock to unlock another vampire. She must burn 1 blood to attempt to block an older vampire.

200092.name: Angelica, The Canonicus

rulings.text: Can only use her ability once per action if she needs intercept, but she can get more than she needs.
The cards must all be burned at once. No further burning can be done once they're replaced.

200092.text: Sabbat cardinal: During an action, Angelica can discard X master cards to get +X intercept.
200092.title: cardinal

200093.name: Angelique
200093.text: Sabbat: While Angelique is ready, cards requiring Necromancy [nec] cost Harbingers of Skulls you control 1 fewer blood.

200094.name: Angelo

rulings.text: A vampire with no circle designation is in his own unique circle of one.

Angelo can be in the "unique circle of one" of any vampire, including another copy of himself. Two uncontrolled Angelo are in different circles, an active Angelo has to choose (eg. for {Unwholesome Bond}).
He cannot attempt an action to employ a retainer, nor strike to steal a retainer.
The ability ability cannot be used to fulfill card requirements if they are not played normally, like when using {Concealed Weapon} for an equipment or {Piper} or {The Summoning} for an ally.

When meeting a requirement to play a card, the vampire is treated as such for all the effects of the card, and only them, including duration effects. The vampire is not treated as meeting the requirements for effects the card has from being in play.

200094.text: Independent. Red List: All Blood Brothers may play cards that require Sanguinus [san] as if Angelo were a member of any circle. Angelo can burn a location as a (D) action. He cannot have or use retainers. Sterile.

201666.name: Aniel
201666.text: Independent: Aniel can burn 1 corruption counter or a card requiring a Discipline from another ready minion as a +1 stealth (D) action that costs 1 blood.

200096.name: Anisa Marianna Lopez
200096.text: Sabbat: Anisa can burn a vampire with a capacity less than 4 controlled by your predator or prey as a (D) action that costs 1 pool.

200098.name: Anka, Priestess of Thorns
200098.text: Sabbat: Anka can enter combat with a Lasombra as a (D) action.

200100.name: Ankla Hotep
200100.text: Independent: Rescuing Ankla from torpor costs 2 fewer blood. He gets 1 optional press each combat.

200101.name: Ankou, The
200101.text: Camarilla: If any vampire successfully hunts while the Ankou is ready and unlocked, the Ankou can burn that vampire as a (D) action that turn (even on another Methuselah's turn).

200102.name: Anna "Dictatrix11" Suljic
200102.text: Anna may move 2 blood from the blood bank to any vampire as a +1 stealth action. During your unlock phase, you may look at the top three cards of your library.

200103.name: Annabelle Triabell

rulings.text: Her ability applies to all Toreadors, not just the ones in play at the time the action resolved.

200103.text: Camarilla primogen: Annabelle can give Toreador vampires +1 bleed for the remainder of the turn as a +1 stealth action that costs 1 blood. If that action is successful, Annabelle unlocks.
200103.title: primogen

201693.name: Annabelle Triabell

rulings.text: The passive ability applies even if the vampire is in torpor.

201693.text: Camarilla primogen: While Annabelle is locked, other Toreador you control get +1 stealth.
201693.title: primogen

200104.name: Annazir

rulings.text: He cannot perform the action provided by his ability twice in the same turn.
The action provided by his ability is directed against the Methuselah controlling the equipment or location, not the minion it's on. "
Keeps their title and votes if they changes sects.

200104.text: Independent. 2 votes (titled): Annazir can burn a location or steal an equipment as a (D) action. Infernal. +1 bleed.
200104.title: 2 votes

200106.name: Anneke

rulings.text: Her ability only affects the rule restricting who gets to block an action. She must still meet all other requirements to block. In particular, {Blood Bond}, {Day Operation}, {Seduction} and prior decision not to block are not circumvented.

200106.text: Camarilla Toreador Justicar: Anneke may attempt to block a vampire controlled by another Methuselah, ignoring the normal prey, predator or target restrictions for blocking actions. +1 bleed.
200106.title: justicar

200107.name: Anson
200107.text: Camarilla Prince of Seattle: If Anson is ready during your master phase, you get two master phase actions (instead of one).
200107.title: prince

200108.name: Antara
200108.text: Independent: Antara gets +1 intercept against Sabbat vampires. He burns 1 blood after any Methuselah plays a Gehenna event. Blood cursed.

200111.name: Antoinette Dubois
200111.text: Independent: Toreador and Toreador antitribu cannot block Antoinette. -1 intercept.

200112.name: Antoinette DuChamp
200112.text: Camarilla: Action cards and strike cards that require Celerity [cel] cost Antoinette an additional blood.

200114.name: Antón de Concepción
200114.text: Sabbat Archbishop of Chicago: Antón gets 1 optional maneuver during the first round of combat.
200114.title: archbishop

200115.name: Antonino
200115.text: Independent: Antonino gets +1 stealth on undirected actions.

200118.title: bishop

Her ability can only be used on an acting bleeding minion.

200119.text: Independent: During a bleed action, Anu can burn 1 blood to give the acting minion +1 bleed. Scarce.

200123.name: Apolonia Czarnecki
200123.text: Camarilla: Apolonia can steal 1 blood from a younger vampire as a (D) action.

rulings.text: Black Hand is not a title, it is a trait unrelated to any sect. The trait is not lost if the vampire changes sect.

200127.name: Arcadian, The

200128.name: Ardan Lane
200128.text: Camarilla primogen: When stealing blood with a strike that requires Blood Sorcery [tha], Ardan steals an additional blood.
200128.title: primogen

rulings.text: Black Hand is not a title, it is a trait unrelated to any sect. The trait is not lost if the vampire changes sect.

200130.name: Aren, Priest of Eshu
200130.text: Laibon: Aren gets +1 stealth on political actions. Any vampire casting votes or ballots against a referendum called by Aren burns 1 blood when the results are tallied.

200131.name: Ariadne

rulings.text: The hunt bonus applies to non-standard hunt actions, blood comes from the target of the hunt.

200131.text: Camarilla: Blood hunts cannot be called on Ariadne. +1 hunt.

200132.name: Ariane

200133.name: Arianne, The Conqueror

rulings.text:
If the combat continues or a new combat begins, the after combat effect does not happen/is not usable. (eg. {Psyche!}, {Telepathic Tracking})
(Partial reversal of RTR 20010711)
Any blood loss occurs after combat (and will not trigger {Anathema} or be available for {Taste of Vitae}, etc).
Damage is applied after combat, so cannot be prevented by combat cards.
Is a damage dealing effect and can be modified by other effects like {Dam the Heart's River}.

Keeps their title and votes if they changes sects.

rulings.text: If his ability is used to cancel a strike, another strike is chosen.

If his ability is used to cancel a limited effect (additional strike), then the limit is not triggered and another limited effect can be used.
Can only cancel minion cards played from the hand in the normal fashion (eg. not weapons played via {Disguised Weapon}).
The scarce penalty considers the apparent clan while controlled (in case of {Clan Impersonation} and {Banishment}).

200145.text: Independent: During a combat, Asguresh can cancel a combat card played by the opposing minion as it is played, and its cost is not paid. Scarce.

rulings.text: Cards are not replaced during the "as played" window. The cancelation must be played immediately: no other effects can be used, except for wakes (eg. neither {The Barrens} nor {Dreams of the Sphinx} can be used).
If the canceled card had a "do not replace until" clause (or alternate replacement like {Steely Tenacity}), that clause is canceled as well and the card is replaced normally.
The canceled card has still been played. The same reaction or modifier cannot be played again by the same minion. Any card which text prohibits to play more than once cannot be played again.
If a limited effect is canceled (bleed, additional strike), then the limit is not triggered and another limited effect can be used.

200493.Card Text: Laibon: Ganhuru can prevent 1 non-aggravated damage each combat. If /Ubende/ is ready, you gain a pool whenever Ganhuru successfully bleeds your prey.

Can be used when stealth is not yet needed. Any stealth that would be gained is not gained (as no stealth is needed).

rulings.text: Black Hand is not a title, it is a trait unrelated to any sect. The trait is not lost if the vampire changes sect.

200497.name: Gavrylo

200498.name: Gem Ghastly

rulings.text: The ability ability cannot be used to fulfill card requirements if they are not played normally, like when using {Concealed Weapon} for an equipment or {Piper} or {The Summoning} for an ally.

When meeting a requirement to play a card, the vampire is treated as such for all the effects of the card, and only them, including duration effects. The vampire is not treated as meeting the requirements for effects the card has from being in play.

200498.text: Camarilla primogen: You and Gem can play cards requiring a Ventrue as if she were a Ventrue.
200498.title: primogen

200499.name: Gemini

200501.text: Sabbat priscus: Genevieve gets one additional vote during each political action.
200501.title: priscus

200503.text:
Anarch: If Gengis is blocked by a titled vampire, he does not unlock as normal during your next unlock phase.
[MERGED] Gengis gets +1 level of Auspex [aus] and Celerity [cel].

rulings.text: [MERGED] Is Camarilla. If the base version was the one in play, it changes sect as it is merged. If it had an anarch token, it is burned.

200529.text:
Advanced, Camarilla: Goratrix can burn a Tremere antitribu as a (D) action.

Black Hand is not a title, it is a trait unrelated to any sect. The trait is not lost if the vampire changes sect.

200584.name: Hektor

201731.name: Hel-Blá

200585.text: Sabbat: Helen cannot have or use equipment. Sterile.

200587.name: Helena

rulings.text: [MERGED] Is Independent. If the base version was the one in play, it changes sect as it is merged. If it had an anarch token, it is burned.
[MERGED] Immune means damage is not inflicted, even if non-preventable or outside combat.

200587.text:
Independent: Helena pays no blood costs for reaction cards requiring Auspex [aus] or Dominate [dom]. Infernal.
[MERGED] Helena is immune to damage from demons and gets +1 level of Daimoinon [dai] and Obtenebration [obt].

rulings.text: Black Hand is not a title, it is a trait unrelated to any sect. The trait is not lost if the vampire changes sect.

200592.text: Sabbat. Mexico City Circle: Hermanas are not unique. When moved to the ready region in your influence phase, this vampire burns 2 blood or is burned.

200593.name: Hermana Hambrienta Menor

rulings.text: If influenced with more blood than her capacity, the blood drain off before her ability forces her to burn 2.
If she creates a vampire (eg. {The Embrace}), they are not Mexico Circle, they are each in their own individual circle of one.

200593.text: Sabbat. Mexico City Circle: Hermanas are not unique. When moved to the ready region in your influence phase, this vampire burns 2 blood or is burned.

rulings.text: The hunt bonus applies to non-standard hunt actions, blood comes from the target of the hunt.

200594.text: Independent: Hesha gets +1 stealth when hunting. +1 hunt.

201591.name: Hesha Ruhadze
201591.text: Anarch: Hesha gets +1 bleed for each unique equipment attached to him.

200597.name: High Priest Angra Mainyu
200597.text: Independent: While Angra is ready, your prey gets -1 hand size. During a non-bleed action, he can burn the Edge to get +1 stealth. Infernal.

200598.name: Hillanvale
200598.text: Independent: During a bleed action, Hillanvale can burn 1 blood and discard a card requiring Melpominee [mel] to get +1 bleed. She gets -1 intercept against non-Independent, non-Anarch vampires.

200599.name: Hiram "Hide" DeVries
200599.text: Camarilla: While Hiram is ready, actions to burn a location you control cost 1 additional blood.

200604.name: Horatio Ballard

rulings.text: Cannot use his special ability to become a Prince if he has changed sect and is no longer Camarilla.

200604.text: Camarilla: If Horatio doesn't have a title, he can call a referendum to become the Prince of Chicago as a +1 stealth political action.

200605.name: Horde, The

rulings.text: The ability can be used when in torpor.

200605.text: Independent: During a bleed action, The Horde can lock to give another acting infernal minion +1 bleed. Infernal. Non-unique.

200606.name: Horrock

200606.text: Independent: Protean [pro] cards cost Horrock 1 less blood.

A {Ghoul Retainer} on her can use a weapon she is holding

200607.text: Sabbat: Howler gets 1 optional maneuver each combat. She cannot use weapons. +1 strength. Sterile.

200612.text: Sabbat: During your unlock phase, you may move a card from your hand to Hukros face down. You may look at the card at any time. Hukros may play that card as if from your hand.

200613.name: Humo
200613.text: Sabbat: If you also control Greensleeves and he is ready, Humo may burn a blood to give Greensleeves +1 stealth once each action.
200613.Card Text: Sabbat: If you also control /Greensleeves/ and he is ready, Humo may burn a blood to give /Greensleeves/ +1 stealth once each action.

200614.name: Husamettin
200614.text: Independent: After Husamettin burns a vampire with a contract on them, you can search your library for a master Discipline card and put it on him (shuffle afterward). Blood cursed.

201697.name: Ian Carfax
201697.text: Camarilla Tremere Justicar: Once each turn after a combat involving Ian ends, he can unlock if the opposing minion is not ready. +1 intercept.
201697.title: justicar

200616.name: Ian Forestal

rulings.text: Can be used to meet one (but not more than one) of the normal Discipline requirements of a multi-Discipline card.
While a minion has an effect that allows them to play cards that require Discipline(s), they do not actually have those Discipline(s).

Multiple similar effects (e.g. two {Infernal Familiar}, or {Ian Forestal} with an {Infernal Familiar}) cannot be used to meet the requirements of a multi-Discipline card that the minion is missing one or more Disciplines to play.

rulings.text: [MERGED] Is Independent. If the base version was the one in play, it changes sect as it is merged. If it had an anarch token, it is burned.

Cards are not replaced during the "as played" window. The cancelation must be played immediately: no other effects can be used, except for wakes (eg. neither {The Barrens} nor {Dreams of the Sphinx} can be used).
If the canceled card had a "do not replace until" clause (or alternate replacement like {Steely Tenacity}), that clause is canceled as well and the card is replaced normally.
The canceled card has still been played. The same reaction or modifier cannot be played again by the same minion. Any card which text prohibits to play more than once cannot be played again.
If a limited effect is canceled (bleed, additional strike), then the limit is not triggered and another limited effect can be used.

(Partial reversal of RTR 20010711)
Any blood loss occurs after combat (and will not trigger {Anathema} or be available for {Taste of Vitae}, etc).
Damage is applied after combat, so cannot be prevented by combat cards.
Is a damage dealing effect and can be modified by other effects like {Dam the Heart's River}.

rulings.text: If a contract chooses her when played (eg. {Dirty Contract}), she is "chosen for the contract" for other cards (eg. {Open Dossier}). If the contract choice is an effect of the card in play (eg. {Clandestine Contract}), she's not chosen.
When playing a card requiring a sect, her title makes her a titled vampire of that sect (eg. she can play {Hand Intervention}).
Orun and Aye cards cannot be placed on her as long as she's not a Laibon.

If her capacity is above 10 when playing {Call the Great Beast}, she burns and it is put into play. If her capacity is less, the card is put on her with tokens equal to her capacity, but she will not be able to add counters to it later on.
You can still use the burn options of cards with a requirement she could meet when you play them, but does not meet while in play.
Keeps their title and votes if they changes sects.
The ability ability cannot be used to fulfill card requirements if they are not played normally, like when using {Concealed Weapon} for an equipment or {Piper} or {The Summoning} for an ally.

When meeting a requirement to play a card, the vampire is treated as such for all the effects of the card, and only them, including duration effects. The vampire is not treated as meeting the requirements for effects the card has from being in play.

rulings.text: Can only use her ability when she is in combat herself.

Cards are not replaced during the "as played" window. The cancelation must be played immediately: no other effects can be used, except for wakes (eg. neither {The Barrens} nor {Dreams of the Sphinx} can be used).
If the canceled card had a "do not replace until" clause (or alternate replacement like {Steely Tenacity}), that clause is canceled as well and the card is replaced normally.
The canceled card has still been played. The same reaction or modifier cannot be played again by the same minion. Any card which text prohibits to play more than once cannot be played again.
If a limited effect is canceled (bleed, additional strike), then the limit is not triggered and another limited effect can be used.

rulings.text: If he plays a action he can only pay for with his ability, he has to use his ability when the action resolves (even if a {Deflection} was played on a bleed).
If he lost a blood during the course of an action that he could have paid for when announced, he can choose whether or not to use his ability to be able to pay for it.
If he cannot pay for the action even with his ability, his ability is not considered used for the action (even if it was announced).
If a card he plays is cancelled as it played and no cost is paid, his ability is not considered used for the turn.
"Once each turn" means once during each player's turn.

201235.name: Santaleous

rulings.text: Can use his ability to cancel a master card multiple times each turn.
When using his ability, the cost of the canceled card must still be paid.

Cards are not replaced during the "as played" window. The cancelation must be played immediately: no other effects can be used, except for wakes (eg. neither {The Barrens} nor {Dreams of the Sphinx} can be used).
If the canceled card had a "do not replace until" clause (or alternate replacement like {Steely Tenacity}), that clause is canceled as well and the card is replaced normally.
The canceled card has still been played. The same reaction or modifier cannot be played again by the same minion. Any card which text prohibits to play more than once cannot be played again.
If a limited effect is canceled (bleed, additional strike), then the limit is not triggered and another limited effect can be used.

201446.name: Vidal Jarbeaux

rulings.text: When meeting a requirement to play a card, he is treated as such for all the effects of the card, and only them, including duration effects. He is not treated as meeting the requirements for effects the card has from being in play.
He can meet the requirements for his controller to play any card, including Master cards.
If a card he plays is canceled as it is played, he is still considered having used the requirement, if any.
Vampire traits: titles, "Red List", "Flight", non-requirements (eg. non-Red List) are vampire traits. Mortal, unlocked, ready, older, Striga, Maleficia, etc. are not.

Titles: When meeting a title requirement, he is considered a member of the underlying sect. He can meet a given generic title (eg. Prince) only once, but the controller chooses how it is met (any city, even a made-up one). He must choose a title when playing a card required a "titled" vampire (eg. {Rubicon}), but can only choose each title once. He can choose the non-descript "X votes" title, but only once.

If a contract chooses him when played (eg. {Dirty Contract}), he is "chosen for the contract" for other cards (eg. {Open Dossier}). If the contract choice is an effect of the card in play (eg. {Clandestine Contract}), he's not chosen.
Orun and Aye cards cannot be placed on him as long as he's not a Laibon.

If his capacity is above 10 when playing {Call the Great Beast}, he burns and it is put into play. If his capacity is less, the card is put on him with tokens equal to his capacity, but he will not be able to add counters to it later on.
You can still use the burn options of cards with a requirement he could meet when you play them, but does not meet while in play.
His ability do not let him fulfill card requirements if they are not played normally, like when using {Concealed Weapon} for an equipment or {Piper} or {The Summoning} for an ally.
When meeting a title requirement for a political action, the vampire does not get the title's votes for the subsequent referendum.
Can meet a sect-specific title (e.g. Justicar) requirement even if the sect does not exist anymore (eg. {Fall of the Camarilla}).

201446.text: Camarilla: Vidal can meet the clan, sect, or non-infernal vampire trait (e.g., Black Hand) requirement to play any card. He can meet a given requirement only once each game. +1 bleed.

201456.name: Vlad Tepes

rulings.text: When playing a card requiring a title or a sect, he is treated as a such for all effects of the card, including duration effects. (eg. he can {Archon} himself and use its effect later)
He can use {No Secrets From the Magaji} to attempt to block a vampire acting with no stealth. REVERSAL from previous rulings.
When meeting a title requirement, he is considered as a vampire of the underlying sect.
When meeting a requirement, the controller can choose how he meets it (eg. he can play {Anarch Secession} as a Prince of any city, even a made-up one).
He can use a card requiring a sect or titled to be played (eg. use {Abbot} intercept bonus as a Sabbat vampire, perform {Archon} action to burn it as a Prince or Justicar).
He cannot use a card as a vampire of a sect or with a title if the card does not require the sect or title to be played. (eg. he cannot benefit from {Powerbase: Madrid} as a Sabbat vampire)

If Vlad gains a title via a title card (eg. {Fee Stake: Perth}), as long as Vlad is not the correct sect, the title is dormant. He counts as untitled if he has a dormant title. He cannot "use" his title to become titled.
When meeting a title requirement for a political action, the vampire does not get the title's votes for the subsequent referendum.
Can meet a sect-specific title (e.g. Justicar) requirement even if the sect does not exist anymore (eg. {Fall of the Camarilla}).
The ability ability cannot be used to fulfill card requirements if they are not played normally, like when using {Concealed Weapon} for an equipment or {Piper} or {The Summoning} for an ally.

201456.text: Independent: Vlad uses and can play cards requiring a title or a sect as if he had that required title or were of that required sect. +1 bleed.

"Once each turn" means once during each player's turn.

201460.text: Anarch: Once each turn, an Anarch you control can unlock after successfully equipping with a vehicle from your hand.

rulings.text: Black Hand is not a title, it is a trait unrelated to any sect. The trait is not lost if the vampire changes sect.

201463.name: Wamukota

rulings.text: If the action continues "as if unblocked", all action modifiers and reaction cards are still in effect, even those pertaining to a successful block.
If the action continues "as if unblocked", Methuselah that had declined to block before do not get another opportunity to block.

"continue as if unblocked" moves the action card from the ash heap (where it went when the action was blocked) to limbo (where it should be if the action is not blocked). If the action card is not in the ash heap, then the action cannot be continued.
His ability to end combat can be used when he is in torpor.

201463.text: Laibon: If another Laibon you control is blocked while equipping, recruiting, or employing, you can lock Wamukota before block resolution to lock the blocking minion and have that Laibon continue the action as if unblocked. +1 bleed.

201464.name: Watenda

rulings.text: The cost he pays takes into account any cost modification that applies for the opposing minion.
When canceling a card, he pays any pool cost in blood.
Can use his ability even if he's going to torpor.
Can only use his ability when he is in combat himself.

Cards are not replaced during the "as played" window. The cancelation must be played immediately: no other effects can be used, except for wakes (eg. neither {The Barrens} nor {Dreams of the Sphinx} can be used).
If the canceled card had a "do not replace until" clause (or alternate replacement like {Steely Tenacity}), that clause is canceled as well and the card is replaced normally.
The canceled card has still been played. The same reaction or modifier cannot be played again by the same minion. Any card which text prohibits to play more than once cannot be played again.
If a limited effect is canceled (bleed, additional strike), then the limit is not triggered and another limited effect can be used.

201464.text: Camarilla: Once each combat, Watenda can cancel the effect of a combat card the opposing minion plays by burning an amount of blood equal to the blood or pool cost of the card. If the card is a strike card, the opposing minion chooses a new strike.

201471.name: Winterlich

rulings.text: You can still use the burn options of cards with a requirement he could meet when you play them, but does not meet while in play.
The ability ability cannot be used to fulfill card requirements if they are not played normally, like when using {Concealed Weapon} for an equipment or {Piper} or {The Summoning} for an ally.

When meeting a requirement to play a card, the vampire is treated as such for all the effects of the card, and only them, including duration effects. The vampire is not treated as meeting the requirements for effects the card has from being in play.

201471.text: Sabbat: Winterlich can recruit a changeling ally as if he met the requirements of playing that card. While he is ready, changelings cost you 1 fewer pool.
